metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22930 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
Node.js before 16.6.0, 14.17.4, and 12.22.4 is vulnerable to a use after free attack where an attacker might be able to exploit the memory corruption, to change process behavior.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.7.0+dfsg-5ubuntu1
nodejs - 18.7.0+dfsg-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.7.0+dfsg-5ubuntu1').
